fields.description:
Upgrading to Confluence 2.3 from 2.2.10 with DB2 running as external DB fails due to the class name change : com.atlassian.util.DB2Dialect was renamed to com.atlassian.hibernate.dialect.DB2Dialect

After changing this in the confluence.cfg.xml the update works.
fields.summary: Upgrade fails for DB2 due to incorrect dialect

fields.description: When external management is configured with users with no full names, a null pointer exception is thrown when going to the people directory.
fields.summary: Confluence should handle users without full names (from external user management)

fields.description:
The getHTML method lowercases the space key, which causes the dosearchsite.action to not properly search the space. 

String spaceKey = macroParameter.get("spaceKey").toLowerCase();

Removing the toLowerCase() fixes the problem, though it would be better to make the dosearchsite.action spaceKey parameter case insensitive.

This defect appears to have been introduced by the fix for CONF-7335 .
fields.summary: livesearch macro with spaceKey parameter set fails for spaces with non-lowercase keys

fields.description:
International characters in page titles aren't  linkable. The anchor is created but marked in red. In the children-view these pages are still accessible.
Examples are:
Übersicht KASS-DB
fields.summary: special character in page title can't be linked to

fields.description:
There seems to be a problem of setting up Oracle against Confluence 2.3 via datasource as well as using direct JDBC connection. Tested on  Oracle 10.x , Tomcat 5.5.x and Windows, using JDBC drivers (thin)  

error: Configuring the database failed. Couldn't create the database schema.

java.sql.SQLException: Io exception: Got minus one from a read call
fields.summary: Problem with Oracle connection with 2.3 Confluence

fields.description: A critical bug (http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/BLOG-5)  has been fixed in the 1.1.1 version of the Blogging RPC plugin.  The confluence bundled version of this plugin needs to be updated to this version with the next point release.
fields.summary: Upgrade the bundled Blogging RPC plugin to version 1.1.1

fields.description:
When I create a PDF at http://confluence.atlassian.com/spaces/exportspace.action?key=CONF20, it generates error 109 when opened (Adobe Reader 7.0), whether opened directly, or saved to disk first.

There is some discussion at http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-3609 about this, but I'm not sure whether it applies in this case.

I don't have any problem with PDFs that I create via our internal Confluence instance.

In addition, I would like to know how this selectable export page was generated.

Thanks very much,

Alan Peterson
apeterson@smartsuper.com.au
+61 4 2338 2100
fields.summary: Error 109 when opening PDF created at http://confluence.atlassian.com/spaces/exportspace.action?key=CONF20

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7681].
  {panel}

I personally like the label rename functionality in del.icio.us:

* https://secure.del.icio.us/settings/tags/rename

For instance, if I have 20 pages labeled as "diagrams" and another 10 pages labeled as "diagram", now if I want to standardize labels in my wiki to be in singular form, I can use the label manager to migrate all "diagrams" to "diagram".

This should be a Confluence-level and space-level functionality.
fields.summary: Label management - renaming, merging, deleting

fields.description:
Hi,
I have implemented my own attachment manager to use subversion as the attachment store.
However at seemingly random times, the renderer fails to render image attachments due to a hibernate error when checking permissions. Note I am using atlassian-user connected to Active Directory for user management.
I don't think this is a problem in my code: there is none of my code in the stack trace below, which is purely checking permissions. Why would the hiberate session be closed already?

Whenever I try to apply a custom colour scheme to a space following the indications here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Editing+a+Space's+Colour+Scheme

I don't get that menu, I get a:


Global Colour Scheme
This colour scheme will use the globally defined colour scheme for this space.
 
Custom Colour Scheme
A custom colour scheme which can be edited.

I select the custom colour scheme, I change colours but they don't reflect in the space. If I change colours in the Administration -> Look and Feel > Colour Schemes screen they do get applied.
fields.summary: Custom colour schemes are not being applied to spaces

fields.description:
We are using the sql macro, but we are predicting significant load on the database when all users will start accessing the pages that are displaying static data from the database.
It would be extremely valuable to add a cache=yes/no option for the sql macro. Do this similarly with the jiraissues macro (including the "refreshNow" button.
Ideally I'd also see a |cacheTime=<hours> so I can specify the time after which the data will be automatically refreshed. We have pages that can be refreshed weekly (of course, the user is free to use the "refreshNow" button) and pages that would be better refreshed daily (or even hourly).

Also it would be very useful to be able to search through the results that are returned by the sql macro. Perhaps make this also configurable if it is a performance concern.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add caching and search into the data for sql macro
blog-posts: Specify both start and stop times

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7665].
  {panel}

It always bothered me that when adding comments to various pages/blogs, it is very difficult to keep track of where these comments actually were posted to and if anybody actually replied to 'mine' comments. 

I can set a watch to a page or a space and get informed when a new comment is added. Nevertheless, I would like the functionality to be able to check a flag when creating a comment to be notified when somebody replies to my comment (yes that's how desperate I am :-)

1. Add comment
2. Notify me on replies to my comment  <Yes/No>

This way, even if I am not watching that space or a page, I will still get notified when somebody replies to my comment. Similarly, I will receive two notifications when watching the page as well - 1. change was made and 2. replies to my comments

Take this little further: I'd like the option of retrieving all mine or a particular user's comments information. Similar to the blog post macro fetching all the posts by a user-name, this functionality would be fetching all the comments or replies by a user name.

A. {getcomments} ivan, from, to, all
B. {getcomments} ivan, from, to, replies-only

Your thoughts?

Ib
fields.summary: Tracking and retrieving users comments and replies

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7664].
  {panel}

Presently when importing data the main heading reports:

"Importing data - In Progress"

The progress messages are displayed in the interim under the progress bar.

When importing is completed, the progress message is displayed accordingly: "Complete"

Yet the main heading remains the same.

I think the message is little confusing: Complete     V     In  progress

We should :
1. Update the heading accordingly - Importing data - Done
2. Improve "Complete" to "Import completed successfully you may now return back to the dashboard"

Simple, yet I think it could help the user to know what happened and where to go after the process finished.

Please see attached pic.

Ib
fields.summary: Improve informativeness of the Importing data message

fields.description:
After performing a method 1 upgrade from a 2.2.9 home with standard installation to 2.3, and waiting until the content indexing is listed as 100% complete, searching for any term retrieves no results. 

The workaround is simply to update any content, or go to Administration >  Content Indexing and selecting Rebuild Search Index.

I have attached two home directories:
1) A home directory for 2.2.9 after performing the standard install. No changes have been made.
2) A home directory for 2.3 created by upgrading the 2.2.9 home directory. No changes have been made. This shows automatic indexing failing. 

Steps To Duplicate:

1. Unzip Confluence 2.2.9
2. Set 2.2.9 home directory
3. Start 2.2.9, perform standard installation, stop 2.2.9
4. Unzip Confluence 2.3
5. Set 2.3 home directory to the 2.2.9 home
6. Start 2.3
7. Login, go to Administration >  Content Indexing and wait until indexing is listed as 100% complete. My instance states:

- Index Summary Tab -
Queue Status:	Queue is currently idle
Time Elapsed:  	5 minutes, 3 seconds
Completion:  	100% complete
Finished reindexing 276 objects.

- Queue Contents Tab -
Queue is currently empty

8. Search for any search term, eg Confluence. No results are found.
fields.summary: Searches return no results after initial index of upgraded data, until content is updated
Isn't removing me from watchers list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7657].
  {panel}

Text separated by any single non-numeric, non-alphabetic character should be indexed a second time using those characters as separators. This will permit much more flexible and realistic search results, since users mentally separate out characters such as my.project and important_document_name.

A suitable programming-related use case is when indexing methods. To index 

dbo.tblTransactions(SomeDataType var)

should produce

dbo.tblTransactions(SomeDataType
dbl
tblTransactions
SomeDataType
var)
var
fields.summary: Use single non-alphabet characters as separators when indexing search terms

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7651].
  {panel}

Confluence should:

1) Serve all pages as UTF-8
2) Require that the application server interpret URLs as being UTF-8 encoded

All modern browsers support this configuration, but we will have to test all our supported appservers to ensure that they can be configured to support (2). And we'll have to provide documentation on how to do this configuration on each appserver.

This will resolve a _lot_ of character encoding issues that are caused by users moving away from UTF-8. It will also mean we can phase out the truly ugly and bug-prone URL-rewriting and double-encoding hacks that plague the codebase.
fields.summary: Remove character encoding configuration from Confluence

fields.description:
I'm not sure whether you would agree this is a bug, but on our systems we upgrade to 2.3 and that exposed this problem which wasn't there in previous versions.

Anyone using the Content Formatting Macro's on their site will suddenly find tables going very screwy as the {table} macro in the Compatibility Macros are suddenly kicking in, in favour of CFM's. As compatibility with snip-snap markup is less likely (at least in our experience) than the desire to generate flexible html using wiki markup, I would vote for disabling the Compatibility Macros plugin by default - which can be easily turned on.

I will file an issue for making macro clashes easier to detect separately here: CONF-7647
fields.summary: Disable Compatibility Macros (confluence.macros.compatibility) by Default

fields.description:
If 3 plugins are installed and all 3 provide a macro called "fish", there is no way to easily know that they are all contending for the same macro name, nor any way of knowing which has won out.

A diagnostic list of macros which are contended, as well as a simple search where I can put in a macro name and it tells me which plugin it is using for that macro, would be very useful.
fields.summary: Provide an easier interface for detecting macro name contention
Deployment of Sources and JavaDocs into Maven 2 Repository

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7645].
  {panel}

Ok, this feature is a little hard to describe, but basically I'd like to solve the problem in this situation: 1. you're viewing a page, 2. you see an area you want to change or add to, 3. you hit edit to make the change and.. 4. uh oh! you have to scroll waay down and look and look and look to find the place you wanted to make the change. This is particularly annoying for non-wysiwyg people but is still a big issue for everyone.

I'd like a feature where you right-click on the page and select "Edit" and then it edits the page but puts the cursor right where you had right-clicked.

Limitations in browsers probably make this difficult, I'm sure. But it would be very useful feature to have. Would save so much time, make the system so much more usable!

Not that this was the best solution, but on a previous wiki (OpenWiki) we added a little hack that helped. You would select some text, then do a key sequence to edit the page like Shift-Ctrl-E, and it would do a search on the text you had selected, then leave the cursor at the beginning of that in the edit mode. As long as the text you selected was unique (99% of the time this was the case if you selected more than a few words) it would put the cursor in the right spot. This was a crappy solution but it was definitely better than scroll scroll look scroll scroll ARGH look scroll...

I'm sure someone who knows more than me about Javascript and DOM's can figure this out. I hope!!
fields.summary: Add a way to move the cursor to the position clicked on when editing
Create super lightweight alternate theme for mobile users

fields.description:
This issue occurred in our production environment.

Space 1 has label "project-planning", and there are 27 items with that label
Space 2 has label "project-planning", and there are 11 items with that label

Open Space 1 -> Browse Space -> Labels -> All Labels
Select "project-planning" label
It displays a page with 10 results. At the top of the page it indicates there are total 27 items.
When user clicks on "Next >>", the total number of items is changed to 38! (total 4 pages)
We can navigate to the items after 27, and we see the items from other spaces with the same label.

I guess the problem is happening because there are other spaces having the same labels. So, if we search on a label from one space, only the first results page will show the correct number. Rest of the results pages show items from all spaces.

 It looks to me like Confluence resubmits the search for each page, and doesn't manage to preserve the "in space" restriction.  

The same problem occurs on Atlassian's own wiki in their Confluence space (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Documentation+Home).  
We don't see it in the current issues list. We think it is a bug, that it is not limiting the search to the current Space (after page 1 of results). 

You may contact  me or "Paula.A.Matuszek@gsk.com" if you have any further questions or if there is any update on this bug.
fields.summary: Searching for pages with a certain label in ONE space returns the pages related to the label in ALL spaces (when clicking on "Next>>" link on first result page)

fields.description:
Our Confluence is set up so that all new spaces are private to the owner (this is a company policy).

Many space owners would like to offer their content to everybody, so they check the view flag in the "Anonymous Access" section. But they are not aware that they also need to grant view access to "confluence-users". 

Otherwise every anonymous user has access to the space until he logs in; but after he has logged in, he can't access the space anymore. This causes a lot of extra work for the company helpdesk.

The problem is of course with the incorrect permission setup of the space. To avoid this sort of mistake, the help text should be reworded somewhat like:

'When a user is using Confluence while not logged in, they are using it anonymously.
For example: Enabling anonymous commenting permission, allows non-logged-in users to make comments in this space.
In most cases, all permissions for the anonymous user should be also granted for the group "confluence-users" in the "Groups" section above.'

This is a trivial modification that will have a significant impact on usability.
fields.summary: misleading description in Edit Space Permissions page

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7636].
  {panel}

Hi,

if you're using a common userbase for Jira and Confluence it would be very nice, to be able to also use Jira Project Roles in Confluence.
e.x. "Grant write access for Space X in Confluence to all members of Role Y in Project Z in Jira."
Otherwise it makes no sense to switch to a role based user management if you've to also manage groups for Confluence.

Best regards
Markus
fields.summary: Integration of Jira Roles in Confluence

fields.description: We believe this issue with Confluence "going down" is related to the increased number of users accessing the system.  We noticed that in  /opt/apache-tomcat-5.5.15/logs has a file called catalina.out.issue; this file had a bunch of   exceptions with "Too many open files".
fields.summary: Confluence hangs and needs to be restarted -

fields.description:
There are a few issues encompassed in this:

1. If my plugin throws a RuntimeException I would expect it to end up in the logs, but by default it doesnt (I have to raise the logging to debug).

2. When I turn logging on I find that its been wrapped up as a java.lang.IllegalStateException - and that is what is displayed as being the problem in the Plugin Manager

What I would like is:

A. Plugin exceptions to be logged at the ERROR level and come out in the logs by default.

B. When a plugin has trouble the Plugin Manager should display the message of the thrown exception, not the wrapped up one which will usually say something unhelpful.

C. I would like the Plugin Manager to store the whole exceptions and have a link where B is shown to popup a window to see the full stack trace and usual confluence state information. Anything else that could help track down where in the plugin to start looking would help.
fields.summary: Plugin's RuntimeExceptions being Wrapped and Swallowed
Error in PDF Export after the first call of a sql-macro producing a table output

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7629].
  {panel}

A new version of the html macro that is secure. 

The html macro is very useful for introducing complex text formatting  but also introduces a serious security risk.  

There is a developer plug in called  "html plug-in"  that claims to be secure by only allowing white-listed html tags and attributes.  However, due to a bug, it is incompatible with the Rich Text Editor.  RTE will strip all the html tags from the content.  

I think a secure html macro would really enhance the product.
fields.summary: A secure html macro

fields.description: This may be related to known issues regarding macros and Rich text editing. To Reporduce: 1. Create a simple macro : $body 2. Create a simple Wiki page : Some text {test}text in a macro{test} Some more text 3. Save. Re-open in Rich Text Editor (RTE). Save. Open as Wiki Markup Some text {test}text in a macro{test}\\ Some more text 4. Save. Re-open in Rich Text Editor (RTE). Save. Open as Wiki Markup Some text {test}text in a macro{test}\\ \\ \\ Some more text Subsequent iterations keep introducing more new lines. Attached picture shows how the rendered content gets worse.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor changes spacing around user-macros

fields.description: am confounded by the way user macros are working. When I open a page containing a user macro in the editor, newlines are being inserted before and after the macro. To demonstrate the problem, 1. I created a simple macro called test that consists of : $body 2. I create wiki page usingmacro Some text {test}text in a macro{test} Some more text 3. I save the page and view. Looks ok. 4. I re-open in the rich text editor: A newline is now inserted between line 2 and 3. Wiki markup is unchanged. I save. 5. A blank line is now between line 2 and 3. 6. I re-open in the rich text edior: 2 blank lines between line 2 and 3. Wiki markup now appears as: Some text {test}text in a macro{test}\\ Some more text I save again. 7. Now there is no padding between line 2 and 3. 8. Open for edit. Wiki Markup is Some text {test}text in a macro{test}\\ Some more text Save. 9. Now there is no padding between any lines. 10. Open for edit. Wiki markup is now Some text {test}text in a macro{test}\\ Some more text And so on.... Note that I am not actually editing any of the content, just opening in rich text editor>>then viewing the wiki markup>>and saving. The appearance is changing each time. Also, the line spacing in the rich text editor differs from that see in the preview or wiki page. This is quite annoying, because every time I make a change anywhere in the page, I have to make sure that the portion around the macro is properly spaced. Am I doing something wrong?
fields.summary: Newlines are being inserted before and after user macro

fields.description:

For example "The embedded hSQL database is not recommended for production use. Please [migrate to an external database]. (Do not remind me again)."

fields.description:
When signing up for an account, it is possible to enter a username like "<script src=http://drevil.com/xss>fred</script>". Confluence will accept this, and on certain pages, render it as raw HTML to the user, opening the possibility of cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

Two places I've spotted the raw HTML so far:

 - Most prominently, when an admin goes to Manage Users -> Show All Users, and the username displays in the list, the raw HTML is rendered.
 - When editing a page created by such a user, the togglePermissions() javascript will display it, breaking later tags:

            if ($('edit-personal').checked) $('editPermission').value = "<script src=http://drevil.com/xss>fred</script>";
fields.summary: XSS bug: usernames not HTML-encoded in all places

fields.description:
The searchQuery.spaceKey parameter used on the Dosearchsite action should be case insensitive.

This currently produces results - http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?searchQuery.queryString=test&searchQuery.spaceKey=CONF20

This should produce results but does not - http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?searchQuery.queryString=test&searchQuery.spaceKey=conf20

This is causing Livesearchto fail to search spaces with keys that contain uppercase characters because it converts the spaceKey parameter to lower case. To replicate, use the livesearch on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Confluence+2+Home

I have temporarily disabled live search on the User Guide patch while this is being patched. One fixed, this can be restored by checking that the latest version is still v. 355, and if so reverting to version 354 via
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=4030505
fields.summary: Dosearchsite action searchQuery.spaceKey parameter should be case insensitive

fields.description:
Recently a user erroneously deleted a group of attachments from a page, but was not supposed to have that level of access. In order to fix the error, the admin had to figure out the identity of and find original versions of the attachments.

A 'restore deleted attachments' should be an option for a designated period of time after attachments are removed. There should be a global recylcing bin, for example.
fields.summary: Administrator should be able to access and restore deleted attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7612].
  {panel}

Situation
- If a user attaches 2 (or more) attachments to a page, and makes a page edit to create links to those attachments, all watchers will get 3 (or more) email notifications for the same page 'activity'

Recommendation
- As with a 'minor update' flag for page updates, a person attaching an attachment should be able to indicate an attachment does not need to trigger a notification event.
- Any file upload action should have the option of not sending a notification.
fields.summary: User adding and Attachment to a page should have option to NOT trigger email notification (a.k.a. Minor Attachment Change)

fields.description:
When an attachment is added, a notification is sent, as expected. However, when an attachment is removed, no notification is sent. This allows vandals to randomly delete attachments for a long time before an administrator would notice there is a security problem.

A notification should be sent to any watchers when an attachment is removed.
fields.summary: Send a notification to any page / space watchers when an attachment, blogpost, comment, page is removed

fields.description:
We should have a hard timeout for any external HTTP requests made by Confluence (i.e. for jiraissues or RSS macros) Currently there's the possibility of DOS-ing a Confluence server by pointing it at a broken website. (See CONF-2127)

HTTP requests should be spawned in a separate thread, using wait/notify to tell the original thread when a result is available, with a reasonable timeout. (Is there something in Concurrent that will do this for us?)
fields.summary: Perform external HTTP requests in another thread

fields.description:
In the Gliffy plugin, we generate images on the fly via our included servlet plugin.

When exporting in .doc or .html formats, the diagram images are not picked up in the exported files.

We were able to work around this issue with PDF export by checking for RenderContextOutputType.PDF.  When RenderContextOutputType.PDF is being used, we have our macro point to the file system which seems to work.
fields.summary: Images produced by macro plugins like Gliffy are not generated into .doc or .html exports

fields.description:

1) Using the plugin manager, install the Gliffy plugin:
http://www.gliffy.com/products/confluencePlugin/download.shtml
2) Add a new Gliffy Diagram
3) View the page containing the Gliffy diagram
4) Using the plugin manager, uninstall the Gliffy plugin
5) Using the plugin manager, install the Gliffy plugin again
6) Attempt to edit the Gliffy diagram


Expected result:
The diagram should open up

Actual result:
The diagram cannot open up. I believe the classes were not unloaded cleanly when the plugin was uninstalled, and this is why this class cast exception pops up.  The work-around is to restart Confluence after Gliffy plugin upgrades.

fields.description:
Moving to hibernate would give us much more efficient searching of users (not having to load them all into memory) than we get currently with OSUser. Plus we wouldn't have to get people to migrate manually whenever they wanted to use LDAP.

In the past we have advised all Confluence customers to manually upgrade their (non-LDAP!) OS-User based installations to Atlassian-User based, because Atlassian-User is way faster when it comes to user-related operations like searching. With Confluence 2.7, we automate this process - on restart of Confluence a (non-ldap!) OS-User based repository automatically will get upgraded to Atlassian-User.

Check the background information in the description of the (now unneeded) manual process: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/How+to+Improve+User+Search+Performance
fields.summary: Automatically migrate Confluence installations to using Hibernate storage for atlassian-user users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7598].
  {panel}

Macros should be able to:

1) Detect they are being rendered for an export
2) Mark that certain resources are required by the export
3) Create "resource links" that the export will understand how to direct to the proper location

This fixes things like CONF-1240 where an arbitrary macro needs to add icons to the export.
fields.summary: Allow macros to add resources (e.g. images) to an export

fields.description:
When editing a link to a page's own local anchor, the Rich Text editor's 'link pop-up' displays the link alias in the 'Alias' input box but it does not display the anchor name in in the 'Link' input box. 

The user is then under the impression that there is no link to an anchor, when in fact there is. 

You need to switch to Wiki Markup mode in order to see the existing link to the anchor.

This issue is being prioritised as 'Major' given that linking to an anchor in Rich Text Editor should be considered basic or core functionality.
fields.summary: When editing an existing anchor link, the rich text editor's link pop-up does not display the anchor name

fields.summary: List installed plugins and install date under System Information

fields.description:
Hello - when I attach a flash file using this sort of syntax,

{code}
!^myflashfile.swf!
{code}

... it plays automatically, which is not so desirable. Flash has parameters which you can normally pass in html - i.e. play=false, menu=true, loop=false - that Confluence does not apparently support. 

This fact makes it impossible (well, impractical) to put multiple flash files on one page, because they will all start playing at once, which is probably not the desired behavior. I believe the default should be to NOT play the file, so that you can get the benefit of having the file show up as a graphic on the page, or if you want it to play, use a parameter to cause that to happen. 

I hope you'll consider this. 

Kind regards,
Rick Cogley
Tokyo
fields.summary: Embedded Flash - cannot stop auto-play

Underlines in the last line of a \{code} or \{noformat} macro can sometimes not be seen due to the styles applied to these macros.

See comments below for a suggested fix.
fields.summary: Underscores hidden by browser rendering bug in {code} and {noformat} macro

fields.description:
Numbered lists and bullet points don't have consistent whitespace when used beneath headings. They should all have the same whitespace as normal text. For example, compare:

h3. Level 3 Heading
# Numbered List Item
# Numbered List Item

h3. Level 3 Heading
Normal Text

Indented points affected include:
- --
* **
# ##
fields.summary: Lists don't have same amount of whitespace beneath headings (compared to normal text beneath headings)

fields.description:
Confluence would benefit from an expandable text macro. At present, toggle-cloak offers a limited workaround such as

{composition-setup}
{toggle-cloak:id=unique1}What is your first question?
{cloak:id=unique1} {panel}Here is an answer \\ \\ on a two lines {panel} {cloak}

{toggle-cloak:id=unique2}What is your second question?
{cloak:id=unique2} {panel}Here is an answer \\ \\ on two lines {panel} {cloak}

However, this could be simplified into

{expand} What is your first question?
Here is an answer 
on two lines
{expand}

{expand} What is your second question? 
Here is an answer 
on two lines
{expand}

- Parameters -
1. bold=true to switch formats from
Question {panel} Answer {panel} 
to
*Question* \\ \\ Answer

This will address the following problems:
- Toggle-cloak does not support multiple lines, so text must be blocked using escaped newlines
- Less error prone than when juggling multiple ids
- Macros can be supported
fields.summary: Create an expandable text macro

fields.description:
Users cannot enable LDAP user integration due to the osuser2atluser.jsp throwing JasperException when visited.

To replicate:
1) Install a fresh instance of Confluence 2.3
2) Download http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/168113/hibernate_osuser_atlassian-user.xml to your confluence/WEB-INF/classes directory
3) Rename to atlassian-user.xml
4) Visit http://localhost:8080/admin/osuser2atluser.jsp

This throws org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSP ... The import com.atlassian.spring.container.ContainerManager collides with another import statement

Full error is attached
fields.summary: osuser2atluser.jsp throws JasperException
